content.title: No Randomness Rule
content.description: All system operations must be deterministic. No use of random number generation, no time-based variation in logic paths. Same inputs must always produce same outputs. This ensures reproducibility and testability.

content.title: Python-Only Implementation
content.description: All brain implementations must be written in Python. No other programming languages are permitted in the core system. This ensures consistency, maintainability, and deterministic behavior.

content.title: Explicit Error Handling
content.description: All operations must use explicit error handling with clear error messages. No silent failures. Return structured error responses with error codes and descriptions.

content.title: Service API Contract
content.description: All brains must expose a service_api function that accepts a message dict with 'op' and 'payload' fields and returns a dict with 'ok' and either 'payload' or 'error' fields. This contract ensures uniform communication.

content.title: No External Network Calls
content.description: Brain operations must not make external network calls or access external services during normal operation. All data must be from local storage or passed parameters. This ensures determinism and security.

content.title: Single Responsibility Principle
content.description: Each brain should have a single, well-defined responsibility. Brains should not overlap in functionality. This ensures clarity, maintainability, and predictable behavior.

content.title: Deterministic Storage
content.description: All data storage operations must be deterministic. Writing the same data multiple times must produce identical files. Use sorted keys in JSON, stable ordering in lists.
